problem:
Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix}.\]
model_solution:
Step 1: Expand the determinant using the first row, so that the expression becomes
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 \begin{vmatrix} 0 & c - b \\ b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} - (b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix}.\]
Step 2: 
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ (a - b)(0) - (c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) - (0)(a - c) \right].\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ 0 - (c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) \right].\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ -(c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) \right]\]
\[= 0 + (b - a) (c - b)(a - c) + (c - a) (a - b)(b - c).\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (b - a)(c - b)(a - c) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\]
Grouping the first two terms together, the expression becomes
\[(b - a)(c - b)(a - c) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\\ = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\\ = (c - a)(a - b)\left[(c - b)+(b - c)\right]\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (c - a)(a - b)\left[(c - b)+(b - c)\right]\\ = (c - a)(a - b)[c - b + b - c]\\ = (c - a)(a - b)(0)\]
Final Answer.
steps:
Step 1: Expand the determinant using the first row, so that the expression becomes
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 \begin{vmatrix} 0 & c - b \\ b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} - (b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix}.\]

Step 2: 
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ (a - b)(0) - (c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) - (0)(a - c) \right].\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ 0 - (c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) \right].\]

\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ -(c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) \right]\]
\[= 0 + (b - a) (c - b)(a - c) + (c - a) (a - b)(b - c).\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (b - a)(c - b)(a - c) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\]

Grouping the first two terms together, the expression becomes
\[(b - a)(c - b)(a - c) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\]

\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\\ = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\\ = (c - a)(a - b)\left[(c - b)+(b - c)\right]\]

\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (c - a)(a - b)\left[(c - b)+(b - c)\right]\\ = (c - a)(a - b)[c - b + b - c]\\ = (c - a)(a - b)(0)\]
Final Answer.
full_steps:
Step 1: Expand the determinant using the first row, so that the expression becomes
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 \begin{vmatrix} 0 & c - b \\ b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} - (b - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & c - b \\ a - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} + (c - a) \begin{vmatrix} a - b & 0 \\ a - c & b - c \end{vmatrix}.\]

Step 2: 
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ (a - b)(0) - (c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) - (0)(a - c) \right].\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ 0 - (c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) \right].\]

\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = 0 - (b - a) \left[ -(c - b)(a - c) \right] + (c - a) \left[ (a - b)(b - c) \right]\]
\[= 0 + (b - a) (c - b)(a - c) + (c - a) (a - b)(b - c).\]
\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (b - a)(c - b)(a - c) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\]

Grouping the first two terms together, the expression becomes
\[(b - a)(c - b)(a - c) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c) = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\]

\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\\ = (c - a)(c - b)(a - b) + (c - a)(a - b)(b - c)\\ = (c - a)(a - b)\left[(c - b)+(b - c)\right]\]

\[\begin{vmatrix} 0 & b - a & c - a \\ a - b & 0 & c - b \\ a - c & b - c & 0 \end{vmatrix} = (c - a)(a - b)\left[(c - b)+(b - c)\right]\\ = (c - a)(a - b)[c - b + b - c]\\ = (c - a)(a - b)(0)\]
Final Answer.
